short_summary: Replacement of Defective Dampers in Ottawa
description: According to the contract request, the successful bidder will be responsible for replacing the defective dampers on ventilation systems of the MTL01 building, 6100 Royalmount Ave, Ottawa, Ontario. This contract involves non-residential building construction services. The initial contract period is expected to last from November 2, 2023, to January 25, 2024. According to the contract tender notice, the potential bidders must attend a mandatory site visit. The site visit will be held on October 10th and October 11th, 2023, at 10:00 am at the site location. One representative from each bidder must attend the site visit and sign the attendance form to ensure their bid is considered valid. The bidders will have to provide a valid CSST certificate with their tender. If any bidders fail to meet these requirements, their bids will be disqualified. The contract was published on September 29, 2023, and the closing date for tender submission is October 26, 2023, at 2:00 pm.
duration_in_months: What is expected is typically around 3 months.
full_summary:
* Government Tender Announcement - Replacement of Defective Dampers in Building MTL01 *
=====================================================

The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is seeking proposals for a project that requires the replacement of defective dampers on ventilation systems in the NRC Building MTL01 in Montreal, Quebec. The project involves non-residential building construction services, specifically commercial and office building construction.

### II. Tender Information

- Tender Reference: 23-58134
- Date of Publication: 2023-09-29
- Tender Closing Date: 2023-10-26T14:00:00
- Expected Contract Start Date: 2023-11-02
- Expected Contract End Date: 2024-01-25

### III. Project Scope

The proposed scope of work includes:

* Replacement of defective dampers on ventilation systems in Building MTL01
* Compliance with all applicable federal, provincial, and municipal regulations

### IV. Mandatory Requirements

- It is mandatory that the bidder attends one of the site visits at the designated date and time.
- At least one representative from the proponents who intend to bid must attend.
- The site visits will be held on October 10th and October 11th, 2023 at 10:00 am.
- Bidders who fail to attend the site visit or sign the attendance form will be deemed non-responsive.

### V. Tender Documents

Tender documents can be obtained through the Government of Canada's procurement service, Buyandsell.gc.ca. Firms electing to bid on this project should also obtain tender documents from this source. Any missing documents will render the bid non-responsive.

### VI. Security Requirements

- All personnel involved in the project must undergo a reliability status level security screening.
- A valid CSST (Commission de la Santé et de la Sécurité du Travail) certificate must be provided with the tender or prior to contract award.

### VII. Contact Information

- Departmental Representative: Martin Legris
- Contracting Authority: Collin Long

### VIII. Attachments

- Tender notice PDF documents are available on the Government of Canada's procurement service website.
